humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report indicates that there are metastases and micrometastases in 14 out of 16 assessed axillary lymph nodes (Metastases et micrometastases carcinomatosae in lymphonodis (No XIV/XVI)). Based on the AJCC staging system and the new rules provided, this corresponds to N3a.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The N stage is determined by the presence and extent of cancer spread to nearby lymph nodes. In this report, the patient has metastases and micrometastases carcinomatosae in 14 out of 16 axillary lymph nodes (No XIV/XVI). This indicates a significant spread of cancer to the lymph nodes, leading to a pathologic N stage of N3. The presence of cancer in the capsule, perinodal tissue, and vascular emboli also supports a more advanced N stage.
